definition: lit. to add oil and vinegar/fig. adding details while telling a story (to make it more interesting)
to add/to increase/to replenish
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
vinegar/jealousy (in love rivalry)

sentences.english: Or have scientists been sexing up the risks and playing down the uncertainties?
sentences.chinese: 或者科学家对风险添油加醋，而贬低了不确定性？

sentences.english: He attempted to add a great amount of imaginary plots to his story.
sentences.chinese: 他试图以大量虚构的情节为自己的故事添油加醋。

sentences.english: I didn’t spice up. All I said is true.
sentences.chinese: 我没有添油加醋，我说的都是事实。

sentences.english: He tried to adorn his story with a lot of lies.
sentences.chinese: 量虚构的情节为自己的故事添油加醋。

sentences.english: The reason for her sudden sexed-up self?
sentences.chinese: 原因是她突然添油加醋的后续自我？

sentences.english: He tried to design many fictional plots to make addictive of his article.
sentences.chinese: 他试图以大量虚构的情节为自己的故事添油加醋。

sentences.english: My classmates told a well-spiced story about it.
sentences.chinese: 我的同学添油加醋地给我讲了这个故事。

sentences.english: The story was reinforced by a spate of anti-China stories circulating in the media.
sentences.chinese: 这一报道因媒体中出现的大量反华内容而添油加醋。

sentences.english: And every time they do, the press pounces.
sentences.chinese: 而每次出了娄子，媒体就会添油加醋。

sentences.english: He tried to make his story with a lot of fabricated plots.
sentences.chinese: 他试图以大量虚构的情节为自己的故事添油加醋。

sentences.english: The reporters were dramatizing the small disagreement we had.
sentences.chinese: 记者们对我们的小分歧作了添油加醋的报道。

definition: to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
(idiom) half true and half false
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to start rumours and create trouble
to exaggerate
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to pass on (stories)/to relate
busybody/CL:個|个[ge4]
